tool.name: Format

param.name: input_trait_table
param.label: Input trait table
param.help: Input trait table in QIIME OTU table format

param.label: Input table delimiter
param.help: The character delimiting fields in the input trait table

param.label: Output table delimiter
param.help: The character delimiting fields in the output trait table

param.name: input_tree_to_trait
param.label: Tree to trait mapping
param.help: An optional two-column, tab-delimited text file mapping identifiers in the tree (column 1) to identifiers in the trait table (column 2). If supplied, the identifiers in the trait table will be converted to match the identifiers in the tree. (This mapping does not need to be supplied if the tree and trait table already use a common set of identifiers.)

param.name: input_limit_otus
param.label: Limit trees
param.help: Prune the reference tree to contain only those tips that are within the given OTU table

param.label: Suppress bifurcating
param.help: If set, don’t ensure that tree is fully bifurcating

param.label: Convert to NEXUS format
param.help: Convert tree to NEXUS format, including a translate block mapping tip names to numbers

param.label: Convert character state to integers
param.help: Convert the values for each character state to integers

param.label: No minimum branch length
param.help: If set, don’t ensure all branches have at least a small but non-zero branch length

param.label: Supress tree filter
param.help: If set, don’t filter out tree tips that aren’t listed in the trait table

param.label: Supress table filter
param.help: If set, don’t filter out trait table entries that aren’t listed in the tree

param.label: Add branch to root
param.help: Add a short branch to the root node (this is required by some phylogeny programs). The length of the branch is determined by the min_branch_length option

tool.help:
@PICRUST_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
This module does numerous formatting and checks to the reference tree and the trait tables. The following steps are done for both the marker gene copy number table and functional trait copy number table:
1. All internal nodes in the reference tree are checked for problematic characters and unlabelled internal nodes are given labels. 2. A pruned tree is created that contains only tips that have copy number predictions from sequenced genomes. 3. Any traits in the trait table that are not in the reference tree are removed.
Optional fixes include:
- Add short (epsilon) branch lengths in place of 0 length branches - Filter out taxa that don't match between tree and trait table - Output tree in NEXUS format - Ensure tree is bifurcating (remove polytomies using very short branches) - Convert floating point trait values to integers - Add a short branch length to the root branch (required by BayesTraits) - Remove internal node names (required by BayesTraits)
Three output files are produced:
- a reference tree Newick file - a pruned tree Newick file - a trait table file
